page.title: 13TRANSPORT
page.content: {TRANSPORT AND ROADS-WHITEGATE. Transport in the area relies solely on roads. There is no water transport of any sort and the only railway line closed in 1966 and is now used as a country park. Apart from the main road which connects Chester with Winsford and ultimately with the motorway system, the majority of roads in the area are narrow and link in a tight network serving the farms and fields. Unfortunately,these narrow roads are inadequate for the increasing amount of traffic which now uses them. Many commuters now use them as a quiet means of crossing the area.Heavy lorries are also becoming more abundent as they transport sand from the sand quarries and potatoes to market. The result has been the imposition of weight limits on a number of local roads.
